website_summaries.verdict: A 6-piece hand file set that is backed by a 100% manufacturer's money-back guarantee.
pros: Crafted from high-end steel that guarantees exceptional strength and versatility
Intended for use with soft metal, wood, and plastic
Nonslip rubber grips ensure you will have no trouble holding each piece comfortably, even in harsh weather conditions
cons: Less durable than many comparable options

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what a I needed, but a bit brittle (broke one of them on my first project)
customer_reviews.text: Pros: They work as intended. Various shapes for various needs. Small enough for fine, small-scale work. Cons: Brittle. I broke the first one I used. Granted, these are needle files, so they're not exactly robust. And, I was working on steel (making a round hole into a square hole), so I was applying moderate force. Still, I think they could be a bit more durable. Bottom line: I would recommend them - just be careful with how much force you use with them. As skinny as they are, they're easy to break.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Consumer

customer_reviews.title: disappointed since i expected better quality from the reviews i ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke on first use.. disappointed since i expected better quality from the reviews i read.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Joining the 1-star chorus on this one. I could say that I've gotten some ok use out of them, and it's true that I have, but if I hadn't bought this set already, I'd buy literally any other option for files. Part of the point of a product review would be to give an item my recommendation or not, and in this case, I'd recommend steering clear unless you have no other option. So brittle I'm afraid of accidentally getting them caught on even the smallest of snags. I've already had 2 break in half with some pretty light use.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3D prints
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up to replace an old file set from years past. They are nothing fancy, but just what I needed to clean up prints from my 3D printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. E

customer_reviews.title: I'm completely satisfied with my purchase but a person should keep in ...
customer_reviews.text: Files are small. Very small. So far have used only the half round on the project which prompted the purchase. Cutting area is not very coarse, so metal is not removed aggressively. For this project, and the small part being modified, it works very well. I'm completely satisfied with my purchase but a person should keep in mind that these are for removing small amounts of metal from small areas. I may never need the remaining files in the set but it's good to know that the tools are in the drawer for any small parts project that comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, gets into small places
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well. Had to file down small area of plastic on a headlight for a good fit. Did the job without issues. Headlights still didn't work so going to try different headlights. Headlights that move around after mounting aren't headlights I want. I have only tried it on the plastic headlights so far. Don't know how it does on other materials.
customer_reviews.author: Goof Ball

customer_reviews.title: Broke during second use on soft plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Second time using one of the files on a soft plastic and it breaks........ Keep in mind that they use all caps when talking about highest quality. Won't get these again, just get the slightly more expensive ones and you will get actual metal.
customer_reviews.author: Nidhoggr

customer_reviews.title: Nice teeny tiny files
customer_reviews.text: I would say that these would work fine for really tiny/small projects like building small models. I was looking to use these to file down a piece of cheap wood on a Gator guitar stand. These would work but it would take a very long time because the files are really small. Again, my bad for not looking at the file width. These are only 3mm wide. I am shocked that the company has refunded me for my error but that is the customer service you'll get. It's top notch and fast.
customer_reviews.author: Crusader

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and not worth it
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Bought this so I could work on my P80 build to smoothen out some rough edges on the polymer. My daughter got a hold of one of the files and the darn thing snapped in half. She is 3 years old and snapped the file in half the day it came in the mail.
customer_reviews.author: jball63

customer_reviews.title: worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Good little file set for me. I mostly use them on plastic but I have sharped metal tools and de-burred drill holes in steel. Mind that they are small and somewhat delicate. More than 10-15lbs of force can likely break them but I've had them over a year without issue. I would recommend a file brush though. They can and will clog with softer material but that's not uncommon with the relatively fine 'grit' of the files. If compared to sand paper, about 200 grit.
customer_reviews.author: FB

customer_reviews.title: Nice little set to have around the house for small repair jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to file the contacts on my washing machines timer control. The file I used was flat and small enough for the job. This set includes varies sizes for all types of small jobs around the house. The handles were easy to grip. For the prices this is a good little set to have around the house since you never know when you might need a metal file for a small repair job. I have no complaints at all since it is a set I won't be using on a daily basis. I was looking for something inexpensive to do a small job and these worked out great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny ATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Material dulls quickly
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a quick modification of a plastic molding and within 5 minutes of filing, I noticed the side of the needle had begun to dull. I constantly had to keep rotating the needle to find a new, fresh area that was still sharp. I appreciate the variety this set presents, but unfortunately an improvement in the hardiness of the material used should strongly be considered.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great little file set
customer_reviews.text: Great little file set. I used this for a project that I needed some smaller sized files. (THESE ARE SMALLER FILE) I was able to use 4 of the set for the specific project that I was doing. They work great for getting burs off of steel that you have cut. Because of their smaller size they can fit in places that larger files that cannot just get.
customer_reviews.author: Info Guy 711

customer_reviews.title: Great Detail Files
customer_reviews.text: I used these files immediately on arrival to correct/adjust some fit problems with aluminum parts, and they worked great. Easy to use, they made quick work shaving on the aluminum in careful increments so I didn't ruin the fit by mistake. I recommend these to anyone working with small metal parts, hobbyists, removing burrs from drill holes etc.
customer_reviews.author: Indymaru

customer_reviews.title: very useful BUT quality is hit and miss
customer_reviews.text: Got these to do some post processing on my 3d printed parts and although i do love how they work, 2 of them did have the actual file fall out of the handle. I had to lightly sand the part that goes inside of the handle and epoxy it back in but other than that, they are super nice and great for the price for sure
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, useful set of files.
customer_reviews.text: These files are hardened steel and appear to be of decent quality. I used them to clean up and form a square notch I cut in a stainless pistol magazine. They are about the right size to do small detail work and have handles to make them more comfortable and easier to use. A diamond set of these same sizes would also be helpful for use on harder material.
customer_reviews.author: Arly from Kentucky

customer_reviews.title: Get these if you have arthritis.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, and price. I have arthritis in my hands and the grips on these files make it so much easier to use. I have had 4 sets of files before these. My biggest complaint has been the grips were too slick and painful to use after an hour of use. Spent entire afternoon with models and these files, no pain, no problems. Will highly recommend these to us older “hands”.
customer_reviews.author: Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for use with steel shaping
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this file set because of the file sizes. I needed to reshape the opening of a new lock strike in the frame of my security door after I replaced the lock. The latch would not engage unless it was in the locked position. These tools were perfect! Already looking for more items I can take care of using this set. Excellent product, Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Teal Waters

customer_reviews.title: Small useful files
customer_reviews.text: Files are as described; small in size. Being thinner than a pencil, doing large areas of filing will be time consuming. The quality of the tool is on par for the price point and to be honest I purchased for a one time use. My set had some imperfections in the hatching and a couple had slightly bent tips. I purchased these to finish out a poly 80 frame and was successful at completing the work with these files.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Limited usage potential
customer_reviews.text: Certainly not for routine use, perhaps for one-time use only? Perhaps my expectations were too optimistic but I would certainly not buy this item again. Basically a toy for use on small toys which is perhaps the intended market. The fault is entirely mine since "one gets what one pays for" is eternally true.
customer_reviews.author: Matha Goram

customer_reviews.title: Every shape you need!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this file set. I broke the tip off a file in my old file set and has lost some so I figured it was time for a new set. I’m glad I got these because this is the first set of hobby files that I’ve had that have handles. The handles make them that much more easy to grip and control. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jam35Gr3g0ry

customer_reviews.title: They work well and as expected except in less than ...
customer_reviews.text: They work well and as expected except in less than a month two of them have snapped. Brittle! I use force but nor excessive. I am finish filing acrylic that was carved with a dremel
customer_reviews.author: Michael L Vetsch

customer_reviews.title: Good file set.
customer_reviews.text: I'd buggered up some brass threads on a pricey bath faucet when my wrench slipped while unscrewing. So it needed to be rethreaded before I could reassemble. These files were just the ticket to remove the damage to individual threads. Files are cut on their edges, as well as on the flats. Rough cuts, not diamond powder. (I wouldn't use them to work on jewelry.)
customer_reviews.author: Paul H Brown

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap junk. The handles pulled out of three of them as soon as I tried to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed little files
customer_reviews.text: Great for touching up 3D prints. Well constructed tiny little files like we had in machine shop when I was in high school. We called them Swiss Files back then. I've had them for a month or 2 now and no rust (critical for me as I live right beside the ocean where everything rusts). Minor negative: A plastic case would be nice but I store them in a drawer sitting on the cheap blister pack case they came in.
customer_reviews.author: Construction Dude

customer_reviews.title: The flat file was the worst. It still is almost unusable because it is ...
customer_reviews.text: They work decently; however, I had a difficult time cleaning them. They worked as intended and I was able to use them for my project, but once they became full of metal they were impossible to clean. The flat file was the worst. It still is almost unusable because it is so full. I tried a wire cleaning brush, towels, and even using something to dig the metal and wax out, but to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Good for what you need
customer_reviews.text: These are a pretty good set of files. The handles are a bit slim so its hard to get a comfortable grip on them. The file themselves work well, but they seem to just collect all the material. Even with trying to wipe or wash them, they seem to keep holding on to the material...but they still work at least
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great for when  a small file is needed
customer_reviews.text: This fantastic set of small multi-purpose files. The handles are great on the hands when you apply pressure. The different shapes allow you to really clean up the work you are working. I find nothing I dislike about this set. Its a great product at a great price and shipped with the dynamic speed of the reliable Amazon system.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Guest

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: These dont work very well on plastics .. I don't know if they will cut/file metals.........
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the size for getting into the finer shaping of ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the size for getting into the finer shaping of craft items made of wood, clay or metal. Each tool, measuring 6" in overall length, fit comfortably in my hands, allowing me to apply finger pressure on the steel shaft for more precise control of the file tip. The handles are roughly 2" in length and allows a good gripping surface for maintaining the longer filing strokes to smooth out or shape a larger area. If these files wear out to the point of being unusable, I will definitely be back to buy another set!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little files.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They are great for getting in tight spaces. I am carving a tiki out of hard white oak and this helps me smooth out the edges in the deep grooves. Glad to have them. I also got a set of small rasps that seem to be from the same manufacturer and they are great as well. Chinese, yes. But the price is right and they do what they are meant to.
customer_reviews.author: EMoon312

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Junk
customer_reviews.text: Cheap junk. Don’t waste your money. Only half of the flat file has file on it. The rest of it is smooth. Now I have to buy another set from someone else.
customer_reviews.author: b. magee

customer_reviews.title: Good for most uses, but for hard metals you may need a dremmel
customer_reviews.text: A couple of these are pretty solid, but I was hoping for the small round one to have more grit. The handles are nice, and I'm glad they came with a case. For doing some really fine sanding in confined spaces on a hard metal, it was OK. Probably ideal for woods and soft metals, or softer things.
customer_reviews.author: ACZ

customer_reviews.title: 5 star seller, 3 star product (toolset does not last long)
customer_reviews.text: I use these to make holes inside wooden flutes that I make. They are very useful but don't have the best quality. One of the tools snapped in half while I was using it and hit my safety glass. I contacted the seller and they sent me a replacement, so a 5 star seller but a 3 star product, hence my rating of 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small files
customer_reviews.text: Excellent small files. These are very sharp and cut well. The files themselves are 5 Star. I took off one star from the total rating because it would be nice if they came in a plastic case, roll-up or flat, that held the files neatly. I put them in a zip lock.
customer_reviews.author: BK 1979

customer_reviews.title: Nice little files
customer_reviews.text: I don't know much about quality, etc. But I do know these do what they are supposed to - file! I got these to file down spots from removed supports on 3D printed items, and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I know literally zero about these kind of tools. I purchased this set because I wanted to make some adjustments on the bridge and tailpiece of my stringed instruments. For the most part, they do what I need. There's really nothing else I can add, so for me and my needs... they're five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A

customer_reviews.title: Big bang for small price
customer_reviews.text: These little buggers so far have worked well. I haven't put much strain on them that would enduce snapping but as for strait line filing they worked well. I used on my Springfield pistol to file down a burrito with no problems or excessive pushing. Small for detail use but not for big jobs. Worth the price by far.
customer_reviews.author: Brentwood

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: It turned out to be smaller than expected. Please do look at the size to set expectation and ensure it fits your use case. The product itself seems to be well built and shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: Gautam

customer_reviews.title: Good quality needle files
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and low price. As long as you dont use them as prybars or screwdrivers, they do the job they were intended to do. Different shapes allow for many, many kinds of use.
customer_reviews.author: ReloadRoss

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you notice the overall size is 6" with handles.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you read the size is 6" overall. They enlarge the photo to make it seem like the files are standard size.
customer_reviews.author: robert t

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for My needs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little file set for my needs (models, 3d printing, arduino models, etc.). Very nice quality - for price I expected something a little chintzy but these are really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C.

customer_reviews.title: Great handles!
customer_reviews.text: Four stars because I haven't used them yet, but the ergonomics of the handle is so much better than the skinny little red ones! Other than that, I'd say they're very similar files, other than a much better handle.
customer_reviews.author: Esuoh03

customer_reviews.title: Broke First Time Used
customer_reviews.text: The half rounded file snapped about 3/4 from the point the first time I used it; not much pressure appleid to cause a break. The "hardened" steel is basically brittle steel. Previous reviewers warned that the files can break and I should had listen.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Bought for clean up on Small 3D prints, very good.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, very good price for product that does what it needs to do. I could wish the handles were slightly larger, but I’ve run into a couple situations where if they had been bigger they wouldn’t have fit in the work space. Would buy again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Nice little file set. I am just using them for 3D printing though so can't say if they are very robust. They work for cleaning up plastic but I can't speak to their durability in harder tasks.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: Used them to fix threads on a few large bolts and they worked well. Transported them in a tool bag Inside the cab of a truck and one snapped in half. So they work but are fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good files but a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I use these to sand down PLA Plastic from 3D prints. Some of the files have come out of their handle, but were easy to superglue back in. The files themselves seem to be pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to clean out the sockets of my landscape lights and needed small files. The circular file was the perfect size. These are a great size for small jobs and the handles are easy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: sleeper

customer_reviews.title: I did read a review stating that it break easily. I should have been more careful
customer_reviews.text: One broke in my upper shirt pocket without doing any work. I did read a review stating that it break easily. I should have been more careful. But still, I am a bit disappointed of the build quality.
customer_reviews.author: yao zhong chen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great set. Small, lots of choices. Well-grained and good for many kinds of jobs.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rockwell

customer_reviews.title: Snapped in half in first minute of use
customer_reviews.text: Using barely any finger pressure at all, two of the files snapped in half (the metal file part) within a minute of use - filing a piece of plastic. This product is junk, do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: spongebob05

customer_reviews.title: Work great, good value.
customer_reviews.text: Good value, they do what they're supposed to do. I was cutting a hole in a GoPro case for power and used these to square off the hole. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: leeg

customer_reviews.title: Small set, but good
customer_reviews.text: The set was smaller than I expected. But it worked well. I am glad I have a good set of these. They are probably best for smaller, detailed work. The quality seems solid.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando H. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs and detail work
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, though they are delicate, in the sense that they are made for detail work in small spaces or for shaping small parts. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Dietz

customer_reviews.title: Nice little file set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set to help me with some aquascaping for my reef tank but the files a lot smaller than I was expecting. They didn't work too well for that specific project but it's a nice set to have around in case I need them for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product*****
customer_reviews.text: Great product and perfect size for my backpack, nicked my axe out in the woods last weekend and I used it to file it smooth and I couldn't have been more pleased with the results. 5*****
customer_reviews.author: Chris b.

customer_reviews.title: Great files for little projects
customer_reviews.text: They are as advertised.. tiny. That’s what we needed for small craft projects.. we do a lot of smoothing of rough edges.. these are quality.
customer_reviews.author: Capt mike

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: It is TERRIBLE! I used the flat one on the first day I got it and it snapped in half.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor at best.
customer_reviews.text: These break with even the slightest pressure, not at all "High Quality".
customer_reviews.author: David E. Swedburg

customer_reviews.title: the files themselves are very nice. Straight
customer_reviews.text: The overmoulding on the handles is a cheap, cheap rubber that dissolves when in contact with motor oils. However, the files themselves are very nice. Straight, with a good bite. Perfect for brass and mild steel work.
customer_reviews.author: Geirskogul

customer_reviews.title: Fragile and frail
customer_reviews.text: They’re super comfortable to hold but extremely fragile. I lost one on the first day and was extremely disappointed in the performance.
customer_reviews.author: TechProTips

customer_reviews.title: Small and ineffective
customer_reviews.text: They are tiny. They were not going to work for the job I needed to do. Maybe if you need something really small to fit in a tiny area. But they don’t seem super strong either. Would barely file my nail, never mind something harder.
customer_reviews.author: A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Fragile Ends...Beware
customer_reviews.text: The tips of the pointed ones broke off while I was sanding a small piece of a new 3D print. The chiseled ones are good but I'm worried that these won't last long-term.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice little file set. The quality is very good and they are easy to hold. I use them for models and they proved perfect for this use. I cannot comment on other uses. They are great overall.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality set, good value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent set, good quality for the money. A lot smaller than I expected but I can use them for other purposes and just get a couple of large ones
customer_reviews.author: Falk Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but could be worse
customer_reviews.text: Broke one the first time I used any of them. My husband broke another one the next day. Have used them a bit since and they have been doing good. Eh... you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: I make jewelry and they come in so handy for getting edges and corners just right!
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor

customer_reviews.title: Easily Broken
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my better half and he almost immediately broke one in half.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good size for working on thinner metal channels (slide/sights). As far as ease of hold, that's subjective. I have very large hands, so I have to use my fingertips to hold these, but it allows me to do finer work.
customer_reviews.author: GGJB

customer_reviews.title: No perfect but works for a bit
customer_reviews.text: They do the job I need. Broke one on day one. The flat ones have a safety side that wont file away material. That's perfect for my use. Also the handle fell off one heating the metal shaft and melting it back in worked fine for me
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Files
customer_reviews.text: A bit small on the handle but what can you expect from a small file set? It's perfect for what I need it for and does the job well. My husband thought they were neat too
customer_reviews.author: Stela

customer_reviews.title: Good mini files.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small jewelry filing. Use for sanding grooves into stones and filing burrs/sharp edges off metal wire. Exactly as described. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Boe

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love these files! They are perfect for jewelry making. They file the sharp metal edges very easily and are great at getting hard to reach places. Definitely recommend as a must have in the toolbox of anyone who does delicate metal work.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Packaging feels like something you get from ...
customer_reviews.text: Good value. Packaging feels like something you get from the dollar store, but that isn't what matters. All the files are straight when new, but can easily be bent if too much pressure is applied on them. Make sure to check the measurements, these were much smaller than I expected!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Very Cheap quality! Broke first use.
customer_reviews.text: I was filing some very thin aluminium for a project im Working on and i know how to use needle files so i wasn't pressing to hard or being overly aggressive, and then Snap! File snapped in half! I couldn't beleive it because i was barely applying any pressure. Im very disappointed. I might consider revising my comment/ Rating if the Seller would contact me to sort this out.
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Super handy for metal patching!
customer_reviews.text: Used these for filing rust out of a small hole in an auto body. They're perfect for light work and small fixes.
customer_reviews.author: Jokerfish

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: perfect for intricate things like jewelry and taking off rough edged of things..everyone needs a set
customer_reviews.author: Cadeyrn

customer_reviews.title: Great files!
customer_reviews.text: I make miniatures and these files have been so amazing! They work great and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: kittiecr

customer_reviews.title: Value!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent assortment to do the job right, and at a great price to boot, you can "file" this one under a job well done!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 6 piece set is now a 5 piece set.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to remove the burrs from circuit boards. After a couple of uses one of the files broke in two. Not high quality.
customer_reviews.author: aw

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING files for the price!
customer_reviews.text: There isnt a thing I dislike about these files. So long as you are careful with them, they work like a charm for small/fine detail work on metal. If anything ever happens to my current set I am absolutely buying another. And on top of that customer service was amazing.
customer_reviews.author: T Berke

customer_reviews.title: Dio the job well
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid these might be cheap, and bend easily. But to my surprise, they are arbitrary and fyi the job well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Payne

customer_reviews.title: They are good and did the job
customer_reviews.text: So I needed some files and got these based on reviews. They are good and did the job, but note that they are rather small. Smaller than I realized, but that's on me for not paying attention.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: Started working with miniatures recently and the files are doing a great job cleaning up spur leftovers and other blemishes. Only complaint is that my triangle file was slightly curved towards the point, but doesn't really hinder the effectiveness of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty Raty

customer_reviews.title: They will do until you can afford better
customer_reviews.text: They work. That’s about all I can say positive about them, besides the price. They feel very cheap, and their size makes them hard to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Macklepenny

customer_reviews.title: cheap, weak metal
customer_reviews.text: The flat file started to bow after a few passes over a plastic model kit. The square file snapped, also while file plastic on a model kit.
customer_reviews.author: D. Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little files
customer_reviews.text: To my surprise, for the price, these are good quality files. I filed some grooves to fit a sight hood on a rifle and these did the job well. Added some bluing and it looks as if the manufacture milled the grooves into the front sight base.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Pure Junk ---
customer_reviews.text: THe file set was a real lightweight piece of do do ... One file snapped in half within a minute of me trying to file away a couple of thousandths of on inch of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Good set
customer_reviews.text: I brought this set for work and they all work pretty good even my boss liked them enough to order a few sets for the workplace. Two of them broke easily but cant complain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SkyJaxx

customer_reviews.title: Look great
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used them yet but, all aspects of the files appear first class. We will see, as time goes by, but I'm glad they are in my tool box!
customer_reviews.author: James H. Cason

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Not what I wanted not good quality hell I was using the flat one and it broke as I filed a gun lol
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sr

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of the oil
customer_reviews.text: A good set of files, but they come oiled. The first step in using them needs to be using brake cleaner to remove the oil.
customer_reviews.author: BMoore

customer_reviews.title: Good Set Of Files
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it a 4-star because plastic vacuform case really can't be used for storage of the files (the case doesn't grip the files tightly enough for them not to come loose and shift.
customer_reviews.author: JimR

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set
customer_reviews.text: It you do intricate wood working, these files will help you achieve nice clean edges.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas N. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Files
customer_reviews.text: If you need files for different sizes and shapes of objects these are the files for you. Keep in mind that these are not large files, they are for small objects but work pretty well on almost anything I have tried it on.
customer_reviews.author: Old Salt on the Coast

customer_reviews.title: I recommend them.
customer_reviews.text: This a decent set of mini files. They are well done, the cutting surfaces are actually sharp and work well. There are no sloppy edges or burrs, and the handles didn't even fall off. I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Blacksheep

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: I was using it to file plastic. First couple files I used snapped way too easily. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived as advertised
customer_reviews.text: These files arrived on time and look to be of good quality. I didn't give 5 stars because I haven't been able to to use them. There is a good selection of shapes and the handles are good quality and ergonomic. I would suggest that they consider a hard case, I would have been willing to pay more for a case.
customer_reviews.author: BVBob

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use small files for crafting
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my wife's craft projects especially jewelry making. Delivered on time
customer_reviews.author: Dick_bangkok

SOFT RUBBERIZED HANDLE - Comfortable Non-Slip Rubber Grips, Keeps a Firm Hold Even in Wet Conditions.
EACH FILE IS CRAFTED FROM ALLOY STEEL - High Carbon Steel Ensures Longevity and Strength
PERFECT FOR NUMEROUS USES - Including Shaping Soft Metal, Wood, annd Plastic
